TopicTitle: Sad trombone for the Sad Whackputer.

Articles.Content:

#EDIT: In honor of my machine, I present a humble 'shoop:

Edited March 6, 2014 by Whackjob

It may look low but these benchmarks are misleading for KSP, IMO. Single core performance is the key here.

Maybe someone could put together a specific KSP benchmark for us
Whackjob, I think you need to build a computer fit for whackjobian-sized ships. I can't imagine what torture you have forced your computer to endure!
Yep,as far I know,Ksp uses single core to calculate physx,so dont trust these benchmarks much,also q series are old but,still have power inside of them

First of I have never seen : Lutefisk with abacus in other cpu charts

As other say for KPS the important thing is single core performance don't think an 6 core i7 does better an an 4 core.

And I who was sure Whackjob and an pc in style with his creations.

Something overpowered with an huge noisy cooler.

A PC in line with his creations would ignite the atmosphere in an attempt to cool then cover his apartment with flaming shrapnel.

But yes, KSP doesnt multi-thread especially efficiently. Very few games do to be honest. The physics passes are a lot of the weight on your processors and are all in a single thread. I usually restrict KSP to a pair of cores trough the task manager and then bump it up to real-time priority. Push any background tasks/services off these 2 cores and you can often squeeze a bit more FPS out of your rig.

You think that's bad...

Also, there is a single thread benchmark on that site too...

http://www.cpubenchmark.net/singleThread.html

I fare a bit better on there... only about 4 times slower than the top-dogs...

It may look low but these benchmarks are misleading for KSP, IMO. Single core performance is the key here.

Maybe someone could put together a specific KSP benchmark for us

Someone's been way ahead of you

In fact, Whackjob can easily compare his machine (and his abacus-wielding lutefisk pet) to the existing results by downloading and running the CPU torture rocket. (It can't be worse than what he usually launches anyway.)

Whackjob, I think you need to build a computer fit for whackjobian-sized ships. I can't imagine what torture you have forced your computer to endure!
